name: Baila Edwards
text: This place is the biggest army surplus store I’ve ever been to. It’s basically military goodwill and has a TON of options on uniforms and other items, including uniform items currently in rotation! I got a used pair of OCP pants that will probably fit better than my issued ones.

name: Brian rosenthal
text: If it had AC would be rated higher lol its hot in there

name: Arnold Clewell
text: They don't have EVERYTHING, but they have lots of cool stuff. Well worth a visit.

name: Theodore Russell
text: I called and asked if they had a poncho and they said they had a stack of them. I drove out there and when I arrived they said “oh I thought you meant a poncho liner” I specifically asked if they had ponchos, and mentioned I was not looking for the liners. I wasted an hour and a half round trip easily.

name: lynn bobik
text: Best place to find real military surplus. Busy, knowledgeable owner. Friendly staff.

name: Jerome Heck
text: Place is run down and dark cant find anything and when you do stuff is mostly damaged or in need of repairs. Not worth the time

name: KEN BURNS
text:
Not what we were hoping to see. More like a second hand store. Seems like the employees could spend some time straightening stuff up.
Oh well

name: MICHELLE BURNS
text: I saw Kaufman's Army Supply advertised on tv so we took a drive to Samson. This is a hugh building packed with military surplus.  Two-thirds of the building is closed off with storage and marked "employees only". The one-third of floor space, with four rows of retail shopping, was just too cluttered in my opinion. Prices were decent, good selection of clothing, and tons of ammo cans. For me it was not worth the 35 mile drive. Plus, it was so cold in the building I had to step outside to get my coat.

name: John Kennedy
text: This place has everything that you've been looking for, and things that you never knew you needed

The person went in the back and then came back and said that the truck driver took the key to the trucks home.  So she couldn't go look on the truck for the size we needed. We had to settle for a different choice.

The staff treated me with More patients than "I" probably could have??!! Lol

resp.text: Hi Jacob, I apologize for the lack of correspondence regarding your web order. Please reach out to me directly at ashley@uspglobal.com and I will be more than happy to look into your order and get you an update. We appreciate your business and want to ensure your satisfaction!

name: CJ Russo
text: Kind of small and a bit pricey but it’s the only place in town to get most of the stuff you would need for deployment.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We strive to offer the items that you need at an affordable price. We continually evaluate our inventory and pricing, so please be sure to check back with us. If you have any suggestions for additional product please let us know! Hope we can assist you in the future.

name: Ann F.
text: My complaint with this location is that the store clerks/ management will ridicule their customers if they don't donate to their charity organization when checking out. When I was checking out and declined to make a donation, Assoc # 092789 loudly expressed her disbelief that I would not donate especially after she redeemed my coupons. I don't believe it is good practice to ridicule customers for not giving to their charities. Donations are a a personal decision and you should not be shamed when you make a personal purchase with an organization.

They have been in the same location for 29 years, so they must be doing something right. Stop by and say howdee.

name: Summer Gragg
text:
I was greeted when I walked in which was great! However, that was the only time I was talked to up until I got to the register. Three women working with a store that was empty besides me and my daughters. Got up to buy a pair of shoes and it came out to $43 and some change. Tried to pay with a $100 bill and was told they cannot break a $100 bill for a $43 pair of shoes. Wow! Really?! I guess cash isn’t good any more! :-/
Disappointed!

name: Amanda Foster
text:
The one standard employee in the store was nice, however, the assistant manager was extremely rude and basically told me to deal with it (because she's the assistant manager). Well, this is me dealing with it. I had a horrible experience, but the prices and sale was good. However, not good enough for me to forget an AM whose immediate response to a customer not knowing return policies is to call the police! And then have the nerve to ask if it's "ok" to hang up. Like, yeah, I'm gonna go bath salts and attack you over your $30 shoes.

Come on, it was totally a power trip because I called her out on being rude. However, I'd like to emphasize everyone else I talked to was very nice and pleasant so it seems to be a management issue more than an employee issue.
